poem:
**Diplomatic Exchanges**

In the quiet hours  
between front page and breakfast,  
Keir, with calculated calm,  
did not mention the elephant,  
how tariffs rumble overseas.  
Instead, he rang Ireland,  
where words stitched  
a vital fabric,  
and the threads of relationship  
held steady.  
Geopolitics waits  
for the poet's hand,  
to weave a gentler call.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keir Starmer did not discuss threat of US tariffs on UK imports in first call with Donald Trump, No 10 says – UK politics live 3.26pm GMT Keir Starmer told Micheál Martin, the Irish PM (taoiseach) that “that the UK-Ireland relationship was going from strength to strength, and it was vital to continue that in such a volatile geopolitical context” in a call this morning, No 10 said. Starmer, who developed a close interest in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
